website_summaries.verdict: This set of tongs is good for those who are looking for a long reach to keep them a safe distance from the fire.
pros: A good value for this 36" long log grabber
Can handle logs up to 8" thick
Works reasonably well for the price
Works well to get logs into position
cons: Does not include a spring assist to aid with grabbing and takes a little bit to figure out how to use

customer_reviews.title: After a quick trip to your local hardware store...it works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: 2 1/2 inch spring from Lowes... drill a small hole... and you have exactly what you wanted - a one-handed log grabber...
customer_reviews.author: David C

customer_reviews.title: It is amazing. As an avid camper who also has a ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this two years ago. It is amazing. As an avid camper who also has a wood burning fireplace at home, this is hands down one of the best products I have ever purchased. I see reviews from people saying they added springs and other auto openers. I don’t understand why that stuff was necessary. It’s one handed as is. My wife uses it just fine. I use it just fine. My friends can use it just fine. There is no need to modify it at all. Hold the main handle between your thumb and palm, use your other four fingers to operate the mechanism. It’s fairly simple. Just like operating pliers one handed.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Most I have seen are about $50 and this one was much less! It works great for grabbing logs in the fire and moving them or turning. It does take 2 hands to work it, it is not spring loaded to open back up so you have to use your other hand to open and close it while holding it with the other, but it is very functional and works for what I needed which is my campfire at the seasonal site. I have been wanting one for a long time and I can't believe I waited 5 years to finally buy one!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel H

customer_reviews.title: THIS TOOL IS GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a grabber that could pickup heavy tree branches and be able to drag the branch away from the tree. I tried those flimsy landscape grabbers and they would not stay gripped and were useless. This thing is great. Will grab and hold without slipping off, and I am sure it could take a lift of 50 lbs.!! It is built solid. I bought another one because it worked so well and there where two of us doing the yanking and pulling.
customer_reviews.author: sosvar2

customer_reviews.title: Broke Almost Immediately ! ! !
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and when it came, was excited to finally be able to maneuver the logs in the fire. Unfortunately, it broke after the second use. When I examined it more closely, I realized that it really is very made of thin and somewhat weak metal. The reality is that I relied on the numerous positive reviews - I'm not sure where the disconnect is but it is not a heavy-duty well-built tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money, add a spring for maximum benefit.
customer_reviews.text: Used this weekend for camping fire management. I added a spring like several of the reviews requested. I used one with an 11 lb pull and it seemed to work great. not to hard to pull, but enough strength to pull the handle back without effort. I would highly recommend this for all you firebugs. works really well to move the hot logs around and get the most from your fire. I would say that the little metal rod that connects the handle to the movable third arm is weak, seems like a likley point of failure. but for $15, who can complain. really happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hewett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We received the Grabber just before we went on a week long trip with friends to northern Minnesota. The temps were cool so we had a fire going most of the time. Everyone thought that the Grabber was a perfect tool for working a fire. Perfect for arranging the fire for cooking or just for warmth. The Grabber was next to the fire pit through rain and shine, Nice tool!!
customer_reviews.author: Catspaw

customer_reviews.title: Wish it opened automatically
customer_reviews.text: This works well for moving logs and grips well. As other reviews have mentioned, it would be perfect if it opened automatically. I got this for my son for our firepit. I was hoping this would keep him away from the flames. Unfortunately, he had a hard time figuring out how to open it with his smaller hands. We ended up returning it and just getting a very longer fire poker. For an adult, the manual opening is probably not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: We do fire pits at nights and needed something to love logs around. This is great and works better than many others because of the 3 prongs. It’s a little hard to use so to the handle design and both myself and my husband had to use 2 hands. But overall worth the purchase and we can manage fires much more easily and without burning my hands!
customer_reviews.author: Justanothermother

customer_reviews.title: The medical industry has nothing like this to offer
customer_reviews.text: I'm disabled. I have been looking for a grabber stick capable of dealing with heavy objects for a long time. The medical industry has nothing like this to offer. I took the advice of some other customers and drilled out a pin hole, added the spring. I took the additional step of wrapping forks as well as part of the handle in amalgamating tape to make it more friendly for delicate objects. I was thinking about adding some sort of brace to extend to my forearm to compensate for the weight. Fantastic product for this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bogin

customer_reviews.title: Your fire needs this; gift one as well
customer_reviews.text: You will not regret this irreplaceable tool; wish I’d thought of it. With two mins use, this tool acts like a rugged hand, not a pincer. I’ve given *several of these as gifts and they are appreciated in the right circles. No, you cannot “just use sticks” after getting one! I have VERY restricted space and would not camp without it. Can I put it more strongly? **Undocumented feature: close your hand over the trigger and BLOW: its a blowpipe, raising a flame from embers!
customer_reviews.author: Craig L

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Designed
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea that was poorly executed. Opening and closing the jaws of the device is counter-intuitive- not at all like the grabby sticks you get at carnivals. If you have weak hands, the design doesn't work. It's too cheap to send back, so I guess I own it. :/
customer_reviews.author: SunnyOne

customer_reviews.title: Works well, durable, just wish was spring loaded.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the intended purpose. Only part I don’t like about the design is that it’s hard to open the prongs with one hand. It’s not spring loaded like I wish it was. Other than that, it’s a great tool and does exactly what it needs to do! Built well and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff DW

customer_reviews.title: This is the best grabber ever! Even better with the modification.
customer_reviews.text: I also made the spring modification. And it was really EASY to do. Once that spring was on this 2-handed log grabber became a 1-handed log grabber. Some of these reviewers who give this only 4 stars, with the modification, are just lame and stingy. It was already well-built and sturdy. This modification just made it better.
customer_reviews.author: mondoleoboy

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy I read the review of how to modify this to a spring load grabber. Defiantly doing this ASAP. However this is a very cheap grabber. You get what you pay for. When this arrived I had to wipe down with a bleach wipe since it looked as if mold was growing on it from damp warehouse conditions. This was probably sitting on the shelf for a while. But other than that it can be tweaked before gifting.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I cut down a couple of small trees and cut them up in 18" logs - and used this to pick them off the ground and toss them (like tossing a shovel of sand) into a pile. Then used it to stack them neatly without all that bending over. I think I'm going to like this thing. OH and I used a bungee cord to act as a spring so it would open automagically. Hooked one end on the bottom and tied the other end to the movable handle to hold it open - no drilling. (I removed the hook on one end of the bungee.) Me likes me log grabber.
customer_reviews.author: Hal in Augusta

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and will last.
customer_reviews.text: This log grabber is very good and easy to use. What's great about it is you can pick up all different size logs and place them exactly how you want them. For larger logs, you might need to use 2 hands. This is actually the 2nd grabber I picked up. The first one I gave as a gift to a friend who loves it. It still works after several years with minimal rust, which is why I got another for myself. I took off 1 star due to the fact that other purchasers have made this truly one-handed by adding a simple spring.
customer_reviews.author: WC

customer_reviews.title: It works well on 18" logs.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this product is absolutely a fabulous deal. It works well on 18" logs (that's what we use in our wood stove). I was worried that it might not be sturdy enough to pick up the burning logs, but it does just fine. I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Bondor

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. The claw part isn't spring loaded in any way so you have to open and close it manually. I expected it to be normally open and squeezing the handle would close it, releasing would spring open. Oh well. Also there was a strong chemical smell the first couple times it was used in the fireplace and it got hot. Really nasty smelling.
customer_reviews.author: Naviathan

customer_reviews.title: It gets heavy lifting a good size log at that distance away from your hands
customer_reviews.text: Well made, but a little heavy. It is big, I found it really a bit long fo use on my fireplace. It gets heavy lifting a good size log at that distance away from your hands. If I was getting another one I would definately get a shorter one. So we use it for the backyard fire pit instead. Good product just remmeber the leverage disadvantage of holding a ten pound log out at 3 feet away from you.
customer_reviews.author: Vermonter

customer_reviews.title: Love this sturdy, heavy-duty, all-steel grabber.
customer_reviews.text: We got this as a multi-purpose grabber/reacher. It is heavy-duty and works very well for our needs. We all had fun taking turns picking up different things from lightweight to heavyweight. The objects stay put until we put them down. We love this grabber. Thank you so much, Amazon, for the super fast shipping and great, highly recommended grabber at a great price. It is so fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I drilled two holes in the grabber and it works great!. You just have to be careful where ...
customer_reviews.text: I took others advice and bought the additional spring. I drilled two holes in the grabber and it works great!. You just have to be careful where to drill. Put the hole near the edge as the spring will not go through if it is too far away. I had to drill a couple to get it right. I used this at a campout this weekend and was able to turn the logs very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S.

customer_reviews.title: Necessary
customer_reviews.text: The most useful tool in fire pit arsenal besides the trusty chopping ax. Lasted a year now and still going strong. The handle feature is tricky and need some redesigning: locking should be made for grip not for ungrip. It is awkward to hold the upper main shaft with one hand and having to keep the squeeze lever up and tightly closed to the main shaft with the other hand. Ideally, for a tight grip, one hand pushes down while the other pushes up (like scissors). In this case, both hands have the tendency to push upward to keep the grip as well as to keep the weight of the wood aloft. The squeeze lever here has little leverage.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for campfires
customer_reviews.text: This was so worth the money. My husband and I go 'glamping' a lot and I use this tool to lift the wood and put on the fire. No splinters. No reaching down into the fire for placement. Easy to maneuver logs around for air flow. Wish I had discovered before. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: This Log Grabber Is AWESOME....!!!
customer_reviews.text: This log grabber is the greatest thing since sliced bread...... once you add the spring to it so that it opens when you release the handle. The spring is the KEY ingredient for a most wonderful experience using this tool...!!!
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Save hands from burning - easy to use - good length
customer_reviews.text: This is saving my poor burned hands. It is a great way to get the burning logs to the place they need to be for a better fire. Some people add a spring to it for a more one handed use, personally it is easy to use with two hands and does not need the spring. For the price - it is priceless!
customer_reviews.author: RStauffer

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have around for your campfires
customer_reviews.text: construction was a little bit lighter than I had imagined, but over all, that turned out to be a good thing. It does the job, it stood up to the campsite and it is lighter to pack than I had anticipated. At this point, the only thing I can think of to improve it would be to make it spring loaded so it opens on its own, which I believe I can accomplish with minimal effort
customer_reviews.author: LynusAnn

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I added a spring as soon as I received it like other reviewers did. Used this week and LOVE it. Time will tell how it holds up. Appears to be well built. Would buy again. Fill the need above and beyond what I hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Christian

customer_reviews.title: Will be grabbing logs for a long time.
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty steel grabber. Everything is made of steel with the exception of the soft plastic handle. The connecting piece between the finger and the handle is also a solid piece of steel. Well build, heavy duty and easy to use. It would be nice if the lever was somehow spring loaded to assist in use, but in reality it's just as easy and natural to operate it with 2 hands. Nothing to do with anything, but there are a ton of grammatical errors on the sticker/product label.
customer_reviews.author: K. Sahm

customer_reviews.title: Wife's favorite valentines gift.
customer_reviews.text: We enjoy a fire in the backyard about once a week. Wife constantly trying to rearrange wood in fire with a stick. Got her this. Put a bow on it. Says it's the best valentines present I ever got her. Yep. I'm a romantic. Order the spring at the same time. You'll be glad.
customer_reviews.author: Rich C

customer_reviews.title: Useful Tool
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Log Grabber for our outdoor fire pit, and it has been very useful. Initially thought 36 in might be too long, but we might actually order a longer one. The mechanisms are very basic, but very effective for moving logs onto and around the fire.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis C.

customer_reviews.title: Best Fireplace Tool Ever
customer_reviews.text: Best fireplace tool ever. Have used these for years; even leave one out on the deck near the firepit at all times. May take two hands for some ladies to use, but you control log placement exactly where you want them. Have tried other brands: not as well made as these.Have given several as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the first
customer_reviews.text: I purchased what I thought was the same thing about three years ago. Although functional, this is not quite as functional as the earlier model
customer_reviews.author: awilli

customer_reviews.title: Need to adjust to your grip
customer_reviews.text: I had to bend the triger to match my hand grasp and I also moved the 2 rods at the other end to 1/4 inch apart +/-. Now it will pick up very small items, It is a little on the heavy side for 1 hand but it does work great after adjusting it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: The company should think about adding that spring that so many buyers did.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is a good deal, it would be 5 starts if they added the spring that some many people in these reviews have done. For a dollar part and minute labor the item would be 5 stars. It makes a large difference in how the product works.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Kunkle

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool, with modifications
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it for one campfire but I love it. So much better than the poker I have been using. My boyfriend added the suggested spring, and also bent the "double metal rod" side of the handle in about a 1/2 inch so that it easier for me to grip. I am a 53 year old female and can easily use it one handed with the modifications. I expect it to last a while if I keep it out of the rain. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good quality good price
customer_reviews.text: It's great that works like a poker also able to grab logs flip them over I'm using it in an indoor fireplace insert I love it replaces all tools except dustpan and broom
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Best fireplace tool for $17
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made heavy duty tool that I use all the time. I am thinking about adding a spring to the handle so it springs back open when I release the handle. I wanted to make my own fireplace log grabber tool but I saw this product and I didn't think i could make it myself without spending more money on steel plus a couple of hours to smith it, weld it and put it together (I use a wood burning brick fire ring as my backyard forge.)
customer_reviews.author: Farmer Nick

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality- Looks Bad
customer_reviews.text: The quality of workmanship is good. Nice and sturdy. The fireplace tongs have stickers that can't be removed on the handle. This will be ok if you are using outdoors. The stickers are too obtrusive to use for fireplace in the house. Will have to return the item.
customer_reviews.author: RKG

customer_reviews.title: Built to last...
customer_reviews.text: These do the job of moving logs around your firepit really well. My wife has to use two hands. But that's a theme for us.
customer_reviews.author: wirecutter

customer_reviews.title: 5-6 months in....
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little bit of getting accustomed to but works well. I’ve had it for maybe 5-6months. I suspect it will hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: B Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This works great for re-positioning the burning logs. Do not expect to pick up a big solid log with these, it is meant for smaller or split logs. Larger logs can be moved around, but do not expect to carry them around. I am very pleased with these and I no longer have a bunch of partially burnt logs in the firepit the next morning.
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Man77

customer_reviews.title: Handy little tool
customer_reviews.text: Works better that I put a spring on it would of gave it five stars if It would’ve came with the spring on it but I put one on myself and I love it
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Bazner

customer_reviews.title: Works well on all but the biggest logs
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool.. would be better if the gripper handle was spring loaded- it requires 2 hands to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but hard for one handed use
customer_reviews.text: Better design and sturdier than the scissor type but still hard to use one handed. Wished it was a bit longer as well.
customer_reviews.author: Horrse

customer_reviews.title: You don't know what you are missing if you are still using a traditional fire-poker for maintaining fire!!
customer_reviews.text: This log-grabber is legit!! We use it every night to re-adjust the logs in our fireplace! I only gave it 4-starts b/c it is missing one thing to be perfect: a spring or something to give it resistance, rather than just hanging open in your hands. This is still a MUST-HAVE purchase, but if they came out with the same one WITH a spring loaded handle...that would be perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Nichelle

customer_reviews.title: Grabber
customer_reviews.text: I’ve given a lot of these as gifts as well as keeping a couple for me. These are great.
customer_reviews.author: dent popped

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one I'm purchaseing. This grabber works great for camp fires moving logs around. Don't expect it to pick up very heavy things, you might be able to, but it was designed to be used for camp fires and fireplaces. Great tool. Highly recommended. Fonzie.
customer_reviews.author: Fonzie

customer_reviews.title: Husband's new camp fire play toy
customer_reviews.text: When camping my husband would find a branch to poke the fire; with this he can load, poke, stoke, move, the camp fire and handle hot items without getting burnt. Awesome price, fast shipping. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: Ackward grip, which should be a rubbery-type material. Not easy to hold with one hand unless you have enormous hands.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, great price, sturdy build.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sturdy, can handle a 25 lb. log without a problem. I'm not sure why a couple people complained about the quality. For $12, it is way better than expected. I imagine I'll have it for several years. The only drawback is that the jaws don't spring open, which isn't really a big deal. It's hardly a setback and can be used easily without.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great item.
customer_reviews.text: This my second I have bought. One for the camper and one for home. Absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Johann

customer_reviews.title: Very good outdoor grabber once the spring modification mentioned in other ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good outdoor grabber once the spring modification mentioned in other reviews is added. It is not very good without it hence the 4 stars. This is heavy duty as far as grabbers go. It is not for picking up small items like a coin or pen. For branches, logs, etc. it is very good and appears durable.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Super easy and it works!
customer_reviews.text: This is an AWESOME little device. We do alot of firws so this has made it way easier to maneuver the logs. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have bought. The first was over 3 years ago and I absolutely love it for camping. You can so easily just pick up the burning logs and move them around as needed.
customer_reviews.author: buzz66boy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: When the gripper arrived I was actually suprised by its durability. It is a little different having to "open" the claw and the close it down on the log. I found the using two hands worked best. It did well on the first (and only) time I used it, but I did find that it wasn't large enough to grab thick cut logs like oak. Small to medium cut logs might work, but if you are looking at thick cut triangles, you may need something entirely different anyway. I would recommend this to the typical homeowner that has a fireplace or something to that effect.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy R. Gleason

customer_reviews.title: Well-built, love it
customer_reviews.text: Checked out different models & read the reviews, and decided to go with this one. Could not have been more pleased. Well-built, can handle average size logs and even larger. Great for using in the firepit to rearrange logs and put new ones in. Family member liked it, so I bought another one for them as a gift. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Goetz

customer_reviews.title: log lifter
customer_reviews.text: I gave this log grabber to my husband for Christmas and the first time he tried to use it, the cable that operates the fingers broke. I will be returning it. We believe that the cable was defective and hope that a new one will be exactly what he wanted. At least we will give the company the opportunity to make good on their product since second chances should always be given in life before giving a negative review, so that's the reason for my 4 stars. My hope is that a return is still possible since it's my fault that I didn't get it sent back right after Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Ann S. Barker

customer_reviews.title: 35" log grabber.
customer_reviews.text: This will be used in conjuction with the 4-piece fire place tool set ordered. This will allow me to adjust burning logs in my wood burning furnace that I purchased thru Amazon.com. This is just the right size to reach in to unit with out taking the chance of burning my hands or arms. It would be nice if the company made a longer one that people could use when camping for handling burning wood in fire pits. This item will be very useful for the reason purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence E. Brown Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect after you buy and install the spring
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers were right on, it should come with the spring. After you buy and install the spring it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: beemer bruce

customer_reviews.title: Meets Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these over a year ago for our patio fire pit; we use it regularly and store it in an outdoor yard box; I purchased it after burning my fingers a few times trying to move logs around with two fire pokers; It has not corroded over the past year, and still works properly; I can pick up large logs without any difficulty; I gave it 5 stars because it met my expectations, moves logs around the fire with ease, and had not become damaged, broken, or corroded with use >1 year; disclaimer: I have not used another log grabber in the past, and so do not have anything to compare it with;
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca A Selgrade

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Not worth it. Can’t pick up logs. It hard to use and cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Great product I've never seen anywhere else...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a log tongs at the big box stores and couldn't find one apart from a set. I stumble on this at Amazon and it looks way nicer and easier to use than any tongs I've struggled with in the past. Voila - it really works great! Highly recommended. You can securely pick up a burning log with this tool and turn or rearrange it. Works great and I'd absolutely buy it again!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott J

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: It is OK. I had to do the spring modification like some other reviewers posted. Took about two minutes and now it works better. It picks up what I want it to. Lets be realistic, you should not be lifting 20 pound flaming logs with this thing. I use it to move almost burned chunks that need to be moved from the sides of my stove or out of the bottom of the ash pile. Not a bad tool at all, just set your expectations.
customer_reviews.author: MikeDaytona675

customer_reviews.title: Best camping tool you can buy. Period.
customer_reviews.text: Might be the single best camping equipment purchase I have ever made! This thing is amazing - place logs, rearrange the fire and even pick up trash. This is a great tool. Just took it on a trip with 50 people, burned 1/4 cord of wood and used this for every piece. It is 3 years old and still works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Randy P.

customer_reviews.title: Need to be modified with springs.
customer_reviews.text: We love this product so much for our home we decided to get two more as Christmas gifts, we modified them with 2 1/2 pound springs, but well worth the investment!!
customer_reviews.author: mammomedic

customer_reviews.title: Cook on the fire.
customer_reviews.text: Came today. Box was destroyed in shipping but item somehow made it. Haven’t had time to use it but looks like it could work.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Dutson

customer_reviews.title: we use these all the time at home and camping
customer_reviews.text: it's cheaper to get these here than at the local hardware store. These are sturdy and rugged. I have been purchasing the brand for around 5 years now and even though I have had to replace them every 2 years, they are well worth the price to have a great way to manipulate wood for fireplaces and campfires. I have purchased 6 for gifts and everyone else loves them too. I usually order three at a time and don't have to pay for shipping - and they arrived fairly quickly too!
customer_reviews.author: Seance

customer_reviews.title: Two hands to use
customer_reviews.text: Grabber requires two hands. Needs some sort of spring to either open or close it so it is easier to use
customer_reviews.author: Andy S.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great log lifter
customer_reviews.text: This is a great log lifter. I did like someone else did (can't remember where I read it) and installed a strong spring (had to drill 2 holes. So that so can pick up and drop a log with one hand. The spring makes the lift arm open when you release the handle. I can't for the life of me imagine why the company does'nt deliver them that way.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt V. Sligh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: If you have a fire pit, get one of these. Its a cool thing to have around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine year one!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gripper and had it for quite some time, it worked great the first year! After the first year and some good usage it started to have mechanical problems (the connection rod to the grips) several times this had to be straightened out and then finally it snapped and its useless. Oh and this is definitely not meant to be left out in the elements un-covered it began to rust and stick in the first year. So if your planned use is for the outdoors, store it when not in use or bring it indoors.
customer_reviews.author: PrincessPowerShopper

customer_reviews.title: Log grabber
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to be the best grabber available on Amazon at the time of purchase. Gave it to my parents as a gift and they like it - large and heavy in weight but the grabbing mechanism probably isn't the strongest. Seems to get the job done but I think next time I would purchase something more like large grabbing tongs - they might last longer, I'm not certain how long this gizmo will last!
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I love the sturdiness of this, and it beats trying to negotiate logs with a poker!
customer_reviews.author: victoria L. Nelsen

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a log grabber
customer_reviews.text: Works well and as expected. Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Roguestorm

customer_reviews.title: Could be better for the $
customer_reviews.text: I just recieved it. First I have to say as I inspect this item was very crapy weld job and item needs two hand because to open you need to use both hands to open it. So would be better if there was a spring set up to open and also not be so stiff. I have not yet tried it yet, so will see I can't talk about how it is when handling wood. But all and all if it handles the wood well then this won't be a total upset. For $30+ dollers. Gave 3 stars because seams very durable. Thanks for reading, B
customer_reviews.author: Bwesthoff

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted for our RV. I found it easy to use right out of the package. No mods necessary.
customer_reviews.author: CC Fellows

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Good price & mostly well built, but could be improved. The handle being NOT spring loaded, makes it harder to use than others. And the one 'jaw' that does move, has a lot of play in it. Could be tightened up.
customer_reviews.author: KnK in CO

customer_reviews.title: Covered in mold/mildew looking stuff, wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Like some other customers, mine came out of the box covered in some sort of mold, mildew or spores of sorts. Aside from that, you'll also need pretty good sized hand span to have the claws in the full open position to grab a log. I'll definitely be doing the spring mod to make things easier. Overall, not totally satisfied :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect gift for the person who has everything. I had to buy one after I saw someone with this while camping. Multiple people that have seem me use this have bought one. I installed a spring on the bottom to make it self-opening.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of the quality just based on the very reasonable price, but trusted the other good reviews here and bought this anyway. I was not disappointed. The quality exceeded my expectations! The length and sturdy construction are perfect. There is no log, regardless of size, that I haven't been able to handle with ease in my fireplace.
customer_reviews.author: kroyster

customer_reviews.title: Works great for fire pit
customer_reviews.text: Use this so much more than I thought I would!! Was going to make modifications from other reviews but works great without them!
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: THE ONE TO HAVE
customer_reviews.text: These make great gifts for your camper friends. I have purchased at least six of these. The Landmann's Log Grabber is the best built Log Grabber and the fairest priced compared to other knockoffs that are available. Trust me, I recently returned two from another seller that were a subpar knockoff.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C.

customer_reviews.title: It's Decent
customer_reviews.text: The mechanism for opening the log grabber is kind of weird. It's almost like it's backwards or something, kind of hard to explain. But for the price compared to others I've seen, it seems like it'll do what I need it to do. It's alright.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok you will need to use both hands to work it
customer_reviews.text: You have to use both hands in order grab a log and hold it as move it
customer_reviews.author: Mohamad Hamdan

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Had to install spring myself as all the reviews say but great item. Perfect for camping
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Great grabber.
customer_reviews.text: Great Grabber. It doesn't have a spring on it, so you need to widen the jaws yourself. That being said, get one.
customer_reviews.author: C. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great product and it works well after doing the modification ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product and it works well after doing the modification with the spring described by other reviewers. No rust so far.
customer_reviews.author: MS-AL

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: At first we thought it was going to be hard to use, something about the way it grabs. My husband is the one that uses it. But, now that he has used it more he seems to like it. It does seem heavy to me lol.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: A piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: What a sad item this is. The handle part that you pull to close the tongs, closes them. But when you pull it back open (and yes you need 2 hands to do that), it doesn't re-open the tongs. Of course, since you just put a piece of wood into a fire... the tongs can be hot. But you can't use your hands to get them open. So basically what you have here is an item that allows you to put 1 piece of wood on a fire. Worthless is what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Love this grabber
customer_reviews.text: Love this grabber! Makes arranging wood in a flaming camp fire 10 times easier! The only issues you'll have after using this, is when you're around a campfire afterwards, if this isn't around, you'll feel like you can't live without it!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Maloney

customer_reviews.title: I like it. High quality.
customer_reviews.text: This works great so far. I'll update if anything changes. I see no need for spring-loading this as some other reviewers have done. The loop in the finger part of the handle makes it easy to open and close, and I feel like I have good control. I use it two handed. One on the control/grip end, and the other just a little further forward on the shaft like you would do with a shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Brice Center

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use with my free standing wood stove and they work great! They are easy to use and they keep your hands and arms away from the hot fire and stove surfaces. They grasp and hold onto the logs with ease.
customer_reviews.author: David P.

customer_reviews.title: Great fire tool! :)
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. Was a huge hit with my friends as well! The only suggestion I would make...have a spring that pulls the handle open for you. Having to open it manually all the time gave me a blister. I'll probly modify the one I have so it has spring assisted opening.
customer_reviews.author: Amy T.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, spring added...
customer_reviews.text: Like some others, I drilled a hole and installed a spring so it opens automatically and can be used single-handed if needed.
customer_reviews.author: dboatrig

customer_reviews.title: So good... they took it.
customer_reviews.text: We camp a lot. We do all our cooking over the campfire. This tool is mission critical to our camp cooking as it makes log placement (important for even heat distribution) a snap. It's so nice that someone stole the first one I bought. Even thieves enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Joz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. We had one for 5 years and used it regularly for backyard campfires until it broke recently. Just received the replacement (glad to buy it again) and look forward to using this one for the next 5 years! This is ideal for adding or adjusting firewood, must suitable for pieces about 4" in diameter.
customer_reviews.author: Eslieb

customer_reviews.title: Landmann 1537 works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I really wasn't sure what to buy here - I just knew I was tired of using a wood stick to move logs around in my back yard fire ring. As it turns out, this product works as advertised and I'd recommend to anyone - I even bought one for a friend.
customer_reviews.author: HAG

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a great item
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure at first, but I love the fact that I can pick up burning wood in the fireplace and move it around for better heating. The handle does not have a spring action, which might have been nice, but I can hold the pole with 2 hands and it really holds on to even a heavier log (10 lbs). Nice item for the price.
customer_reviews.author: K. C.

customer_reviews.title: Could be longer
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had any issues with this even after several fires and being left out in the rain. My only complaint is that I wish it was longer.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Jones

product_meta.title: Landmann 1537 Log Grabber, 26", Black
product_meta.description:
Size:36" x 3" x 3.75" (Length x Width x Height)Log Grabber, 36"

AMAZON.COM
Reassemble smoldering logs in a teepee or A-frame formation for enhanced burn longevity and heat productivity with this handy log grabber from Hearthmates. With durable steel construction and a powder coat finish, the log grabber resists heat from burning firewood. The rubber grip handle stays cool to the touch and features three-grip tongs for extra safety and adaptability. A spring-loaded lever action allows users to manipulate firewood with relative ease. The grabber picks up logs and branches up to 8 inches in diameter. The log grabber measures 35 inches long, and weighs 4 pounds upon shipping. --Jessica Reuling
feature_bullets: Lever action handle with rubber grip
Black powder coat finish suitable for both indoor and outdoor use
Rubber grip handle stays cool to the touch for comfort; grabber picks up logs up to 8 inches in diameter
Grabber measures 35 inches long; weighs 4 pounds upon shipping
Lever action handle with rubber grip
Black powdercoat finish suitable for both indoor and outdoor use.
Rubber grip handle stays cool to the touch for comfort; grabber picks up logs up to 8 inches in diameter
Grabber measures 36 inches long; weighs 4 pounds upon shipping
